turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Please, No Police.
turn.1: What is the novel Please, No Police about?
turn.2: Please, No Police Please No Police is a 1981 novel written by a Turkish author named that follows a cast of German and Turkish characters living in Berlin, Germany, in 1973.
turn.3: What is the setting of the novel?
turn.4: More specifically, the characters operate in the Kreuzberg district of Berlin.
turn.5: Who are the main characters of the novel?
turn.6: The story primarily concerns the Turkish migrant Ali who is illegally in Germany trying to find work, Frau Gramke, and Brigitte Gramke who is the daughter of Frau Gramke and Bruno Gramke.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The beginning of the Guest Worker program in Germany started with the postwar labor recruitment treaty.
turn.9: Which countries were the guest workers from?
turn.10: The Federal Republic of Germany signed a treaty with Italy in 1955 which defined what a “guest” worker or Gastarbeiter is and the application process that allowed them to enter the country.
turn.12: Guest Worker programs came about due to the high labor demand from industrialized economies of Western Europe and the excess labor supply from less industrialized countries.
